body:
Hi all,

It is known that Bitcoin miners could be a problem in the near future (what if a miner can mine more than 50% of transactions? what about electricity waste caused by mining?...).

To avoid that, why do not remove all transaction fees and in exchange, the bitcoin sender must perform some mining every time they make a bitcoin transaction? this way, the sender will act as a miner for a few transactions of others. The system will be self-regulated: the more transactions are in the system, the more miners there will be available.

Nowadays, there are javascript libraries doing that for miners, so when you enter in a website you are mining for others, many times illegally because they do not warn you. Why do not include that in the core of Bitcoin? That way:

- Fees would be removed and any transaction would be completely free
- Electricity waste caused by mining would be dramatically reduced
- The system would be self-regulated regarding to mining tasks
- Senders would know they have to perform some mining
- Mining tasks would be re-distributed instead of centralized as it is happening now (miners are concentrated where electricity and technology are cheaper)

Hope this help and thank you very much for your great effort!

Regards.

Note: apologize if this is not the right place to share my thoughts :)
title: Miners redesign
